methods.name: quit
methods.description: Try to close all windows. The before-quit event will be emitted first. If all windows are successfully closed, the will-quit event will be emitted and by default the application will terminate. This method guarantees that all beforeunload and unload event handlers are correctly executed. It is possible that a window cancels the quitting by returning false in the beforeunload event handler.

methods.name: focus
methods.description: On Linux, focuses on the first visible window. On macOS, makes the application the active app. On Windows, focuses on the application's first window.

methods.name: hide
methods.description: Hides all application windows without minimizing them.

methods.name: show
methods.description: Shows application windows after they were hidden. Does not automatically focus them.

returns.description: The current application directory.

methods.name: getPath
methods.description: You can request the following paths by the name:

returns.description: A path to a special directory or file associated with name. On failure an Error is thrown.

methods.name: getFileIcon
methods.description: Fetches a path's associated icon. On Windows, there a 2 kinds of icons: On Linux and macOS, icons depend on the application associated with file mime type.

returns.description: The version of the loaded application. If no version is found in the application's package.json file, the version of the current bundle or executable is returned.

methods.name: getLocale
methods.description: To set the locale, you'll want to use a command line switch at app startup, which may be found here. Note: When distributing your packaged app, you have to also ship the locales folder. Note: On Windows you have to call it after the ready events gets emitted.

returns.description: The current application locale. Possible return values are documented here.
Array of ProcessMetric objects that correspond to memory and cpu usage statistics of all the processes associated with the app.

methods.name: setBadgeCount
methods.description: Sets the counter badge for current app. Setting the count to 0 will hide the badge. On macOS it shows on the dock icon. On Linux it only works for Unity launcher, Note: Unity launcher requires the existence of a .desktop file to work, for more information please read Desktop Environment Integration.

returns.description: Whether the call succeeded.
The current value displayed in the counter badge.

events.name: will-quit
events.description: Emitted when all windows have been closed and the application will quit. Calling event.preventDefault() will prevent the default behaviour, which is terminating the application. See the description of the window-all-closed event for the differences between the will-quit and window-all-closed events. Note: On Windows, this event will not be emitted if the app is closed due to a shutdown/restart of the system or a user logout.

events.name: quit
events.description: Emitted when the application is quitting. Note: On Windows, this event will not be emitted if the app is closed due to a shutdown/restart of the system or a user logout.

properties.name: bounce
properties.description: When critical is passed, the dock icon will bounce until either the application becomes active or the request is canceled. When informational is passed, the dock icon will bounce for one second. However, the request remains active until either the application becomes active or the request is canceled.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Can be `critical` or `informational`. The default is `informational`

returns.description: an ID representing the request.

properties.name: cancelBounce
properties.description: Cancel the bounce of id.

properties.name: downloadFinished
properties.description: Bounces the Downloads stack if the filePath is inside the Downloads folder.

properties.name: setBadge
properties.description: Sets the string to be displayed in the dockâ€™s badging area.

returns.description: The badge string of the dock.

properties.name: hide
properties.description: Hides the dock icon.

properties.name: show
properties.description: Shows the dock icon.

returns.description: Whether the dock icon is visible. The app.dock.show() call is asynchronous so this method might not return true immediately after that call.

properties.name: setMenu
properties.description: Sets the application's dock menu.

modules.name: clipboard
modules.description: Perform copy and paste operations on the system clipboard.

returns.description: The content in the clipboard as plain text.

methods.name: writeText
methods.description: Writes the text into the clipboard as plain text.

returns.description: The content in the clipboard as markup.

methods.name: writeHTML
methods.description: Writes markup to the clipboard.

returns.description: The image content in the clipboard.

methods.name: writeImage
methods.description: Writes image to the clipboard.

returns.description: The content in the clipboard as RTF.

methods.name: writeRTF
methods.description: Writes the text into the clipboard in RTF.

methods.name: readBookmark
methods.description: Returns an Object containing title and url keys representing the bookmark in the clipboard. The title and url values will be empty strings when the bookmark is unavailable.

methods.name: writeBookmark
methods.description: Writes the title and url into the clipboard as a bookmark. Note: Most apps on Windows don't support pasting bookmarks into them so you can use clipboard.write to write both a bookmark and fallback text to the clipboard.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Clears the clipboard content.

returns.description: An array of supported formats for the clipboard type.

modules.name: desktopCapturer
modules.description:
Access information about media sources that can be used to capture audio and
video from the desktop using the navigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia API.

methods.name: getSources
methods.description: Starts gathering information about all available desktop media sources, and calls callback(error, sources) when finished. sources is an array of DesktopCapturerSource objects, each DesktopCapturerSource represents a screen or an individual window that can be captured.

properties.name: types
properties.description: An array of Strings that lists the types of desktop sources to be captured, available types are screen and window.

properties.name: thumbnailSize
properties.description: The size that the media source thumbnail should be scaled to. Default is 150 x 150.

modules.name: dialog
modules.description: Display native system dialogs for opening and saving files, alerting, etc.

methods.name: showOpenDialog
methods.description: The browserWindow argument allows the dialog to attach itself to a parent window, making it modal. The filters specifies an array of file types that can be displayed or selected when you want to limit the user to a specific type. For example: The extensions array should contain extensions without wildcards or dots (e.g. 'png' is good but '.png' and '*.png' are bad). To show all files, use the '*' wildcard (no other wildcard is supported). If a callback is passed, the API call will be asynchronous and the result will be passed via callback(filenames). Note: On Windows and Linux an open dialog can not be both a file selector and a directory selector, so if you set properties to ['openFile', 'openDirectory'] on these platforms, a directory selector will be shown.

properties.name: buttonLabel
properties.description: Custom label for the confirmation button, when left empty the default label will be used.

properties.name: properties
properties.description: Contains which features the dialog should use. The following values are supported:

possibleValues.description: Allow multiple paths to be selected.

properties.name: message
properties.description: Message to display above input boxes.

properties.name: securityScopedBookmarks
properties.description: Create when packaged for the Mac App Store.

parameters.name: filePaths
parameters.description: An array of file paths chosen by the user

parameters.name: bookmarks
parameters.description: An array matching the filePaths array of base64 encoded strings which contains security scoped bookmark data. securityScopedBookmarks must be enabled for this to be populated.

returns.description: , an array of file paths chosen by the user, if the callback is provided it returns undefined.

methods.name: showSaveDialog
methods.description: The browserWindow argument allows the dialog to attach itself to a parent window, making it modal. The filters specifies an array of file types that can be displayed, see dialog.showOpenDialog for an example. If a callback is passed, the API call will be asynchronous and the result will be passed via callback(filename).

properties.name: defaultPath
properties.description: Absolute directory path, absolute file path, or file name to use by default.

properties.name: buttonLabel
properties.description: Custom label for the confirmation button, when left empty the default label will be used.

properties.name: message
properties.description: Message to display above text fields.

properties.name: nameFieldLabel
properties.description: Custom label for the text displayed in front of the filename text field.

properties.name: showsTagField
properties.description: Show the tags input box, defaults to true.

properties.name: securityScopedBookmarks
properties.description: Create a when packaged for the Mac App Store. If this option is enabled and the file doesn't already exist a blank file will be created at the chosen path.

parameters.name: bookmark
parameters.description: Base64 encoded string which contains the security scoped bookmark data for the saved file. securityScopedBookmarks must be enabled for this to be present.

returns.description: , the path of the file chosen by the user, if a callback is provided it returns undefined.

methods.name: showMessageBox
methods.description: Shows a message box, it will block the process until the message box is closed. It returns the index of the clicked button. The browserWindow argument allows the dialog to attach itself to a parent window, making it modal. If a callback is passed, the dialog will not block the process. The API call will be asynchronous and the result will be passed via callback(response).

properties.name: type
properties.description: Can be "none", "info", "error", "question" or "warning". On Windows, "question" displays the same icon as "info", unless you set an icon using the "icon" option. On macOS, both "warning" and "error" display the same warning icon.

properties.name: buttons
properties.description: Array of texts for buttons. On Windows, an empty array will result in one button labeled "OK".

properties.name: defaultId
properties.description: Index of the button in the buttons array which will be selected by default when the message box opens.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title of the message box, some platforms will not show it.

properties.name: message
properties.description: Content of the message box.

properties.name: detail
properties.description: Extra information of the message.

properties.name: checkboxLabel
properties.description: If provided, the message box will include a checkbox with the given label. The checkbox state can be inspected only when using callback.

properties.name: checkboxChecked
properties.description: Initial checked state of the checkbox. false by default.

properties.name: cancelId
properties.description: The index of the button to be used to cancel the dialog, via the Esc key. By default this is assigned to the first button with "cancel" or "no" as the label. If no such labeled buttons exist and this option is not set, 0 will be used as the return value or callback response. This option is ignored on Windows.

properties.name: noLink
properties.description: On Windows Electron will try to figure out which one of the buttons are common buttons (like "Cancel" or "Yes"), and show the others as command links in the dialog. This can make the dialog appear in the style of modern Windows apps. If you don't like this behavior, you can set noLink to true.

properties.name: normalizeAccessKeys
properties.description: Normalize the keyboard access keys across platforms. Default is false. Enabling this assumes & is used in the button labels for the placement of the keyboard shortcut access key and labels will be converted so they work correctly on each platform, & characters are removed on macOS, converted to _ on Linux, and left untouched on Windows. For example, a button label of Vie&w will be converted to Vie_w on Linux and View on macOS and can be selected via Alt-W on Windows and Linux.

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: The index of the button that was clicked.

parameters.name: checkboxChecked
parameters.description: The checked state of the checkbox if checkboxLabel was set. Otherwise false.

returns.description: , the index of the clicked button, if a callback is provided it returns undefined.

methods.name: showErrorBox
methods.description: Displays a modal dialog that shows an error message. This API can be called safely before the ready event the app module emits, it is usually used to report errors in early stage of startup. If called before the app readyevent on Linux, the message will be emitted to stderr, and no GUI dialog will appear.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title to display in the error box.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The text content to display in the error box.

modules.name: globalShortcut
modules.description: Detect keyboard events when the application does not have keyboard focus.

methods.name: register
methods.description: Registers a global shortcut of accelerator. The callback is called when the registered shortcut is pressed by the user. When the accelerator is already taken by other applications, this call will silently fail. This behavior is intended by operating systems, since they don't want applications to fight for global shortcuts.

methods.name: isRegistered
methods.description: When the accelerator is already taken by other applications, this call will still return false. This behavior is intended by operating systems, since they don't want applications to fight for global shortcuts.

returns.description: Whether this application has registered accelerator.

methods.name: unregister
methods.description: Unregisters the global shortcut of accelerator.

events.name: suspend
events.description: Emitted when the system is suspending.

events.name: on-ac
events.description: Emitted when the system changes to AC power.

events.name: on-battery
events.description: Emitted when system changes to battery power.

events.name: shutdown
events.description: Emitted when the system is about to reboot or shut down. If the event handler invokes e.preventDefault(), Electron will attempt to delay system shutdown in order for the app to exit cleanly. If e.preventDefault() is called, the app should exit as soon as possible by calling something like app.quit().

events.name: lock-screen
events.description: Emitted when the system is about to lock the screen.

events.name: unlock-screen
events.description: Emitted as soon as the systems screen is unlocked.

methods.name: getHeapStatistics
methods.description: Returns an object with V8 heap statistics. Note that all statistics are reported in Kilobytes.

methods.name: getProcessMemoryInfo
methods.description: Returns an object giving memory usage statistics about the current process. Note that all statistics are reported in Kilobytes.

properties.name: workingSetSize
properties.description: The amount of memory currently pinned to actual physical RAM.

properties.name: peakWorkingSetSize
properties.description: The maximum amount of memory that has ever been pinned to actual physical RAM.

properties.name: privateBytes
properties.description: The amount of memory not shared by other processes, such as JS heap or HTML content.

properties.name: sharedBytes
properties.description: The amount of memory shared between processes, typically memory consumed by the Electron code itself.

methods.name: getSystemMemoryInfo
methods.description: Returns an object giving memory usage statistics about the entire system. Note that all statistics are reported in Kilobytes.

properties.name: total
properties.description: The total amount of physical memory in Kilobytes available to the system.

properties.name: free
properties.description: The total amount of memory not being used by applications or disk cache.

properties.name: swapTotal
properties.description: The total amount of swap memory in Kilobytes available to the system.

properties.name: swapFree
properties.description: The free amount of swap memory in Kilobytes available to the system.

properties.name: mas
properties.description: A Boolean. For Mac App Store build, this property is true, for other builds it is undefined.

properties.name: resourcesPath
properties.description: A String representing the path to the resources directory.

properties.name: windowsStore
properties.description: A Boolean. If the app is running as a Windows Store app (appx), this property is true, for otherwise it is undefined.

properties.name: chrome
properties.description: A String representing Chrome's version string.

properties.name: electron
properties.description: A String representing Electron's version string.

modules.name: protocol
modules.description: Register a custom protocol and intercept existing protocol requests.

methods.name: registerStandardSchemes
methods.description: A standard scheme adheres to what RFC 3986 calls generic URI syntax. For example http and https are standard schemes, while file is not. Registering a scheme as standard, will allow relative and absolute resources to be resolved correctly when served. Otherwise the scheme will behave like the file protocol, but without the ability to resolve relative URLs. For example when you load following page with custom protocol without registering it as standard scheme, the image will not be loaded because non-standard schemes can not recognize relative URLs: Registering a scheme as standard will allow access to files through the FileSystem API. Otherwise the renderer will throw a security error for the scheme. By default web storage apis (localStorage, sessionStorage, webSQL, indexedDB, cookies) are disabled for non standard schemes. So in general if you want to register a custom protocol to replace the http protocol, you have to register it as a standard scheme: Note: This method can only be used before the ready event of the app module gets emitted.

parameters.name: schemes
parameters.description: Custom schemes to be registered as standard schemes.

properties.name: secure
properties.description: true to register the scheme as secure. Default false.

methods.name: registerFileProtocol
methods.description: Registers a protocol of scheme that will send the file as a response. The handler will be called with handler(request, callback) when a request is going to be created with scheme. completion will be called with completion(null) when scheme is successfully registered or completion(error) when failed. To handle the request, the callback should be called with either the file's path or an object that has a path property, e.g. callback(filePath) or callback({path: filePath}). When callback is called with nothing, a number, or an object that has an error property, the request will fail with the error number you specified. For the available error numbers you can use, please see the net error list. By default the scheme is treated like http:, which is parsed differently than protocols that follow the "generic URI syntax" like file:, so you probably want to call protocol.registerStandardSchemes to have your scheme treated as a standard scheme.

methods.name: registerStringProtocol
methods.description: Registers a protocol of scheme that will send a String as a response. The usage is the same with registerFileProtocol, except that the callback should be called with either a String or an object that has the data, mimeType, and charset properties.

methods.name: registerHttpProtocol
methods.description: Registers a protocol of scheme that will send an HTTP request as a response. The usage is the same with registerFileProtocol, except that the callback should be called with a redirectRequest object that has the url, method, referrer, uploadData and session properties. By default the HTTP request will reuse the current session. If you want the request to have a different session you should set session to null. For POST requests the uploadData object must be provided.

properties.name: contentType
properties.description: MIME type of the content.

properties.name: data
properties.description: Content to be sent.

methods.name: unregisterProtocol
methods.description: Unregisters the custom protocol of scheme.

methods.name: isProtocolHandled
methods.description: The callback will be called with a boolean that indicates whether there is already a handler for scheme.

modules.name: remote
modules.description: Use main process modules from the renderer process.

methods.name: require
methods.description: e.g.

returns.description: The object returned by require(module) in the main process. Modules specified by their relative path will resolve relative to the entrypoint of the main process.

methods.name: getCurrentWindow
methods.description: Note: Do not use removeAllListeners on BrowserWindow. Use of this can remove all blur listeners, disable click events on touch bar buttons, and other unintended consequences.

returns.description: The window to which this web page belongs.
The web contents of this web page.
The global variable of name (e.g. global[name]) in the main process.

properties.name: process
properties.description: The process object in the main process. This is the same as remote.getGlobal('process') but is cached.

modules.name: screen
modules.description: Retrieve information about screen size, displays, cursor position, etc.

methods.name: getCursorScreenPoint
methods.description: The current absolute position of the mouse pointer.

returns.description: The primary display.
An array of displays that are currently available.
The display nearest the specified point.
The display that most closely intersects the provided bounds.

methods.name: screenToDipPoint
methods.description: Converts a screen physical point to a screen DIP point. The DPI scale is performed relative to the display containing the physical point.

methods.name: dipToScreenPoint
methods.description: Converts a screen DIP point to a screen physical point. The DPI scale is performed relative to the display containing the DIP point.

methods.name: screenToDipRect
methods.description: Converts a screen physical rect to a screen DIP rect. The DPI scale is performed relative to the display nearest to window. If window is null, scaling will be performed to the display nearest to rect.

methods.name: dipToScreenRect
methods.description: Converts a screen DIP rect to a screen physical rect. The DPI scale is performed relative to the display nearest to window. If window is null, scaling will be performed to the display nearest to rect.

events.name: display-added
events.description: Emitted when newDisplay has been added.

events.name: display-removed
events.description: Emitted when oldDisplay has been removed.

events.name: display-metrics-changed
events.description: Emitted when one or more metrics change in a display. The changedMetrics is an array of strings that describe the changes. Possible changes are bounds, workArea, scaleFactor and rotation.

modules.name: shell
modules.description: Manage files and URLs using their default applications.

methods.name: showItemInFolder
methods.description: Show the given file in a file manager. If possible, select the file.

returns.description: Whether the item was successfully shown.

methods.name: openItem
methods.description: Open the given file in the desktop's default manner.

returns.description: Whether the item was successfully opened.

methods.name: openExternal
methods.description: Open the given external protocol URL in the desktop's default manner. (For example, mailto: URLs in the user's default mail agent).

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Max 2081 characters on windows, or the function returns false.

properties.name: activate
properties.description: true to bring the opened application to the foreground. The default is true.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: If specified will perform the open asynchronously.

returns.description: Whether an application was available to open the URL. If callback is specified, always returns true.

methods.name: moveItemToTrash
methods.description: Move the given file to trash and returns a boolean status for the operation.

returns.description: Whether the item was successfully moved to the trash.

methods.name: beep
methods.description: Play the beep sound.

methods.name: writeShortcutLink
methods.description: Creates or updates a shortcut link at shortcutPath.

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: Default is `create`, can be one of following:

possibleValues.description: Creates a new shortcut, overwriting if necessary.
Updates specified properties only on an existing shortcut.
Overwrites an existing shortcut, fails if the shortcut doesn't exist.

returns.description: Whether the shortcut was created successfully.

methods.name: readShortcutLink
methods.description: Resolves the shortcut link at shortcutPath. An exception will be thrown when any error happens.

classes.name: Menu
classes.description: Create native application menus and context menus.

staticMethods.name: setApplicationMenu
staticMethods.description: Sets menu as the application menu on macOS. On Windows and Linux, the menu will be set as each window's top menu. Passing null will remove the menu bar on Windows and Linux but has no effect on macOS. Note: This API has to be called after the ready event of app module.

staticMethods.name: getApplicationMenu
staticMethods.description: Note: The returned Menu instance doesn't support dynamic addition or removal of menu items. Instance properties can still be dynamically modified.

returns.description: The application menu, if set, or null, if not set.

staticMethods.name: sendActionToFirstResponder
staticMethods.description: Sends the action to the first responder of application. This is used for emulating default macOS menu behaviors. Usually you would use the role property of a MenuItem. See the macOS Cocoa Event Handling Guide for more information on macOS' native actions.

staticMethods.name: buildFromTemplate
staticMethods.description: Generally, the template is an array of options for constructing a MenuItem. The usage can be referenced above. You can also attach other fields to the element of the template and they will become properties of the constructed menu items.

instanceMethods.name: popup
instanceMethods.description: Pops up this menu as a context menu in the BrowserWindow.

properties.name: window
properties.description: Default is the focused window.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Default is the current mouse cursor position. Must be declared if y is declared.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Default is the current mouse cursor position. Must be declared if x is declared.

properties.name: positioningItem
properties.description: The index of the menu item to be positioned under the mouse cursor at the specified coordinates. Default is -1.

properties.name: callback
properties.description: Called when menu is closed.

instanceMethods.name: closePopup
instanceMethods.description: Closes the context menu in the browserWindow.

instanceMethods.name: append
instanceMethods.description: Appends the menuItem to the menu.

returns.description: the item with the specified id

instanceMethods.name: insert
instanceMethods.description: Inserts the menuItem to the pos position of the menu.

instanceProperties.name: items
instanceProperties.description: A MenuItem[] array containing the menu's items. Each Menu consists of multiple MenuItems and each MenuItem can have a submenu.

instanceEvents.name: menu-will-close
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a popup is closed either manually or with menu.closePopup().

classes.name: MenuItem
classes.description: Add items to native application menus and context menus.

properties.name: click
properties.description: Will be called with click(menuItem, browserWindow, event) when the menu item is clicked.

properties.name: role
properties.description: Define the action of the menu item, when specified the click property will be ignored. See .

properties.name: type
properties.description: Can be normal, separator, submenu, checkbox or radio.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: If false, the menu item will be greyed out and unclickable.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: If false, the menu item will be entirely hidden.

properties.name: checked
properties.description: Should only be specified for checkbox or radio type menu items.

properties.name: submenu
properties.description: Should be specified for submenu type menu items. If submenu is specified, the type: 'submenu' can be omitted. If the value is not a then it will be automatically converted to one using Menu.buildFromTemplate.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique within a single menu. If defined then it can be used as a reference to this item by the position attribute.

properties.name: position
properties.description: This field allows fine-grained definition of the specific location within a given menu.

instanceProperties.name: enabled
instanceProperties.description: A Boolean indicating whether the item is enabled, this property can be dynamically changed.

instanceProperties.name: visible
instanceProperties.description: A Boolean indicating whether the item is visible, this property can be dynamically changed.

instanceProperties.name: checked
instanceProperties.description: A Boolean indicating whether the item is checked, this property can be dynamically changed. A checkbox menu item will toggle the checked property on and off when selected. A radio menu item will turn on its checked property when clicked, and will turn off that property for all adjacent items in the same menu. You can add a click function for additional behavior.

instanceProperties.name: label
instanceProperties.description: A String representing the menu items visible label.

instanceProperties.name: click
instanceProperties.description: A Function that is fired when the MenuItem receives a click event.

classes.name: NativeImage
classes.description: Natively wrap images such as tray, dock, and application icons.

properties.name: scaleFactor
properties.description: Defaults to 1.0.

returns.description: A Buffer that contains the image's PNG encoded data.
A Buffer that contains the image's JPEG encoded data.

properties.name: scaleFactor
properties.description: Defaults to 1.0.

returns.description: A Buffer that contains a copy of the image's raw bitmap pixel data.

properties.name: scaleFactor
properties.description: Defaults to 1.0.

returns.description: The data URL of the image.

instanceMethods.name: getBitmap
instanceMethods.description: The difference between getBitmap() and toBitmap() is, getBitmap() does not copy the bitmap data, so you have to use the returned Buffer immediately in current event loop tick, otherwise the data might be changed or destroyed.

properties.name: scaleFactor
properties.description: Defaults to 1.0.

returns.description: A Buffer that contains the image's raw bitmap pixel data.

instanceMethods.name: getNativeHandle
instanceMethods.description: Notice that the returned pointer is a weak pointer to the underlying native image instead of a copy, so you must ensure that the associated nativeImage instance is kept around.

returns.description: A Buffer that stores C pointer to underlying native handle of the image. On macOS, a pointer to NSImage instance would be returned.
Whether the image is empty.

instanceMethods.name: setTemplateImage
instanceMethods.description: Marks the image as a template image.

returns.description: Whether the image is a template image.

parameters.name: rect
parameters.description: The area of the image to crop.

returns.description: The cropped image.

instanceMethods.name: resize
instanceMethods.description: If only the height or the width are specified then the current aspect ratio will be preserved in the resized image.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defaults to the image's width.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Defaults to the image's height.

properties.name: quality
properties.description: The desired quality of the resize image. Possible values are good, better or best. The default is best. These values express a desired quality/speed tradeoff. They are translated into an algorithm-specific method that depends on the capabilities (CPU, GPU) of the underlying platform. It is possible for all three methods to be mapped to the same algorithm on a given platform.

returns.description: The resized image.
The image's aspect ratio.

instanceMethods.name: addRepresentation
instanceMethods.description: Add an image representation for a specific scale factor. This can be used to explicitly add different scale factor representations to an image. This can be called on empty images.

properties.name: scaleFactor
properties.description: The scale factor to add the image representation for.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defaults to 0. Required if a bitmap buffer is specified as buffer.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Defaults to 0. Required if a bitmap buffer is specified as buffer.

properties.name: buffer
properties.description: The buffer containing the raw image data.

properties.name: dataURL
properties.description: The data URL containing either a base 64 encoded PNG or JPEG image.

classes.name: Tray
classes.description: Add icons and context menus to the system's notification area.

instanceMethods.name: destroy
instanceMethods.description: Destroys the tray icon immediately.

instanceMethods.name: setImage
instanceMethods.description: Sets the image associated with this tray icon.

instanceMethods.name: setPressedImage
instanceMethods.description: Sets the image associated with this tray icon when pressed on macOS.

instanceMethods.name: setToolTip
instanceMethods.description: Sets the hover text for this tray icon.

instanceMethods.name: setTitle
instanceMethods.description: Sets the title displayed aside of the tray icon in the status bar (Support ANSI colors).

instanceMethods.name: setHighlightMode
instanceMethods.description: Sets when the tray's icon background becomes highlighted (in blue). Note: You can use highlightMode with a BrowserWindow by toggling between 'never' and 'always' modes when the window visibility changes.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Highlight mode with one of the following values:

possibleValues.description: Highlight the tray icon when it is clicked and also when its context menu is open. This is the default.

instanceMethods.name: setIgnoreDoubleClickEvents
instanceMethods.description: Sets the option to ignore double click events. Ignoring these events allows you to detect every individual click of the tray icon. This value is set to false by default.

returns.description: Whether double click events will be ignored.

instanceMethods.name: displayBalloon
instanceMethods.description: Displays a tray balloon.

instanceMethods.name: popUpContextMenu
instanceMethods.description: Pops up the context menu of the tray icon. When menu is passed, the menu will be shown instead of the tray icon's context menu. The position is only available on Windows, and it is (0, 0) by default.

instanceMethods.name: setContextMenu
instanceMethods.description: Sets the context menu for this icon.

instanceMethods.name: getBounds
instanceMethods.description: The bounds of this tray icon as Object.

returns.description: Whether the tray icon is destroyed.

instanceEvents.name: click
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the tray icon is clicked.

returns.name: bounds
returns.description: The bounds of tray icon.

returns.name: position
returns.description: The position of the event.

instanceEvents.name: right-click
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the tray icon is right clicked.

returns.name: bounds
returns.description: The bounds of tray icon.

instanceEvents.name: double-click
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the tray icon is double clicked.

returns.name: bounds
returns.description: The bounds of tray icon.

instanceEvents.name: balloon-show
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the tray balloon shows.

instanceEvents.name: balloon-click
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the tray balloon is clicked.

instanceEvents.name: balloon-closed
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the tray balloon is closed because of timeout or user manually closes it.

instanceEvents.name: drop
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when any dragged items are dropped on the tray icon.

instanceEvents.name: drop-files
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when dragged files are dropped in the tray icon.

returns.name: files
returns.description: The paths of the dropped files.

instanceEvents.name: drop-text
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when dragged text is dropped in the tray icon.

returns.name: text
returns.description: the dropped text string.

instanceEvents.name: drag-enter
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a drag operation enters the tray icon.

instanceEvents.name: drag-leave
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a drag operation exits the tray icon.

instanceEvents.name: drag-end
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when a drag operation ends on the tray or ends at another location.

instanceEvents.name: mouse-enter
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the mouse enters the tray icon.

returns.name: position
returns.description: The position of the event.

instanceEvents.name: mouse-leave
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the mouse exits the tray icon.

returns.name: position
returns.description: The position of the event.

instanceEvents.name: mouse-move
instanceEvents.description: Emitted when the mouse moves in the tray icon.

returns.name: position
returns.description: The position of the event.

properties.name: percentCPUUsage
properties.description: Percentage of CPU used since the last call to getCPUUsage. First call returns 0.

properties.name: idleWakeupsPerSecond
properties.description: The number of average idle cpu wakeups per second since the last call to getCPUUsage. First call returns 0. Will always return 0 on Windows.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier associated with the display.

properties.name: rotation
properties.description: Can be 0, 90, 180, 270, represents screen rotation in clock-wise degrees.

properties.name: scaleFactor
properties.description: Output device's pixel scale factor.

properties.name: touchSupport
properties.description: Can be available, unavailable, unknown.

properties.name: pid
properties.description: Process id of the process.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Process type (Browser or Tab or GPU etc).

properties.name: memory
properties.description: Memory information for the process.

properties.name: cpu
properties.description: CPU usage of the process.

properties.name: x
properties.description: The x coordinate of the origin of the rectangle (must be an integer)

properties.name: y
properties.description: The y coordinate of the origin of the rectangle (must be an integer)

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the rectangle (must be an integer)

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the rectangle (must be an integer)

properties.name: target
properties.description: The target to launch from this shortcut.

properties.name: cwd
properties.description: The working directory. Default is empty.

properties.name: args
properties.description: The arguments to be applied to target when launching from this shortcut. Default is empty.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description of the shortcut. Default is empty.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: The path to the icon, can be a DLL or EXE. icon and iconIndex have to be set together. Default is empty, which uses the target's icon.

properties.name: iconIndex
properties.description: The resource ID of icon when icon is a DLL or EXE. Default is 0.

properties.name: appUserModelId
properties.description: The Application User Model ID. Default is empty.

properties.name: pid
properties.description: Process id of the process.

properties.name: workingSetSize
properties.description: The amount of memory currently pinned to actual physical RAM.

properties.name: peakWorkingSetSize
properties.description: The maximum amount of memory that has ever been pinned to actual physical RAM. On macOS its value will always be 0.

properties.name: privateBytes
properties.description: The amount of memory not shared by other processes, such as JS heap or HTML content.

properties.name: sharedBytes
properties.description: The amount of memory shared between processes, typically memory consumed by the Electron code itself
